revised_title: Correlation Between Barometric Heights at Atlantic Stations
tldr: The authors studied the correlation between barometric heights at various stations on the eastern side of the Atlantic Ocean. They discovered that the correlation between stations varies in summer and winter months and that there is a zone of positive correlation followed by a zone of negative correlation. The authors also found that the barometric height at a station is more closely related to stations in the southern hemisphere than to those closer by.
